registers.name: BOOT_CFG
registers.description: Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Primary boot source

values.name: SECONDARY_BOOTLOADER
values.description: Secondary Boot loader in Bank1 IFR0 (32KB)

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bitfields.description: ISP boot interface

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Recovery boot source

values.name: SB3_IMAGE
values.description: SB3 image in 1-bit SPI flash connected to FlexComm. FC7 used for this function by default

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Boot speed. Selects the core frequency and voltage to use during ROM execution

bitfields.name: CMPA_HEADER
bitfields.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x5963. After this header is set, all non-zero values will take effect; leaving all settings at 0xff will cause undefined behavior. It is recommended to set all values to 0x00 before setting the CMPA header value

registers.name: FLASH_CFG
registers.description: Flash Configuration

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bitfields.description: Flash remap size. FLASH_REMAP_SIZE defines the size of the secondary boot image (the range of flash addresses that will be remapped)in internal flash, where remapped address end = (FLASH_REMAP_SIZE + 1)

bitfields.name: OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT
bitfields.description: Defines flash protection of Bank1_IFR0 area based on usage. The MBC module is used to configure the access protections as readable (R), writeable (W), and/or executable (X). The access protections can also be configured as locked (L) which prevents later application code from changing the access protection configuration. The final MBC protection bits used for Bank1_IFR0 depend on the boot mode configuration, the boot path that is selected and the device life cycle state. The access This field will only modify the MBC protection bits for the Bank1_IFR0 area after the life cycle is advanced out of Develop. In the Develop life cycle state this field has no effect. For example, if using the In-Field life cycle and Bank1_IFR0 is being used as a recovery boot image (REC_BOOT_SRC = 1) and OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT value = 5 is selected), then for a regular boot using the primary image Bank1_IFR0 is mapped to GLBAC2. If the primary boot fails, and the recovery path is taken, then Bank1_IFR0 is mapped to GLBAC4 instead. Note: Settings 5-7 should not be used if Bank1_IFR0 is used as OEM_SBL (BOOT_SRC = 2). In Develop life cycle - All settings: MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1110 (GLBAC0) In other life cycles –

values.name: OEM_ROM_RWXL_CODE
values.description: Not determined by ROM (MBC fields are modified by OEM code)

values.name: OEM_ROOT_RWXL_1010
values.description: Used as OEM Root of Trust image, in other words secondary boot loader (OEM_SBL). MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1010. Updatable by OEM code later

values.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_1011
values.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1011

values.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_0011
values.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 0011

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1010
values.description: Used as OEM recovery boot image with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to user image

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1011
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 1011 on ROM exiting to user image

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0011
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 0011 on ROM exiting to user image

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0001
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 0001 on ROM exiting to user image

bitfields.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion

bitfields.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command

bitfields.name: ISP_API_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through ROM API call. ISP mode can be entered through ROM API invocation

bitfields.name: ISP_FT_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through image authentication failure

registers.name: BOOT_LED_STATUS
registers.description: Boot LED Status

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on recovery boot. ROM drives the GPIO pin high, identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and fall through to recovery boot source. [4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on ISP fall through. ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and execution falls through to ISP mode. [[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on fatal errors during boot. ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails due to fatal errors before locking-up/reset. [4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

registers.name: BOOT_TIMERS
registers.description: Boot Timers

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description: Powerdown timeout: ISP mode peripheral detection timeout value in seconds. If a non-zero value is program and peripheral activity is not detected within the number of seconds specified here, then the device will go to power down mode to conserve power

bitfields.name: WDOG_TIMEOUT_COUNT
bitfields.description: WDOG timeout: Upper 16 bits of 24-bit count value in WWDT0_TC register Timeout value in seconds. The lower 8 bits of WWDT0_TC are set to 0. When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM configures the watch dog timer to reset the device on timeout before passing execution control to user code

registers.name: Reserved 0x00010
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: Reserved 0x00014
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: REC_SPI_FLASH_CFG0
registers.description: Recovery SPI Flash Configuration 0

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SCK_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_SCK ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_SCK_PIN

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MOSI_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_MOSI ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_MOSI_PIN

registers.name: REC_SPI_FLASH_CFG1
registers.description: Recovery SPI Flash Configuration 1

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MISO_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_MISO ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MISO pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MISO_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_MISO_PIN

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_SSEL ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SSEL pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_SSEL_PIN

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_X
bitfields.description: SPI chip select number. FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_PIN_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined pins for 1-bit SPI recovery boot pins

registers.name: ISP_USB_ID
registers.description: ISP USB Identification

bitfields.name: USB_Vendor_ID
bitfields.description: Customer defined USB vendor ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration

bitfields.name: USB_Product_ID
bitfields.description: Customer defined USB product ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration

registers.name: ISP_USB_CFG
registers.description: ISP USB Configuration

bitfields.name: USBx_VBUS_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default USBx_VBUS_DETECT ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as USBx_VBUS detect pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: USBx_VBUS_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by USBx_VBUS_PIN

bitfields.name: EXT_XTAL_CLK
bitfields.description: USB PHY input clock frequency. For USB high speed PHY external XTAL input is needed. This field specifies the frequency of XTAL used on board. • 000 - 24MHz input clock (Divide by 20) • 001 - 30MHz input clock (Divide by 16) • 010 - 32MHz input clock (Divide by 15) • 011 - Reserved • 100 - 20MHz input clock (Divide by 24) • 101 - 19.2MHz input clock (Divide by 25) • 110 - 16MHz input clock (Divide by 30) - Default option when CMPA is blank. • 111 - 12MHz input clock (Divide by 40)

values.name: XTAL_16MHZ
values.description: 16MHz input clock (Divide by 30) - Default option when CMPA is blank

bitfields.name: PRE_DIV
bitfields.description: Enable Pre-divider. Needed to support 48MHz and other high speed crystals

registers.name: ISP_MISC_CFG
registers.description: ISP Miscellaneous Configuration

bitfields.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDR
bitfields.description: I2C slave address A 7-bit Address used for selecting our device on shared I2C bus system. By default ROM uses 0x10 as slave address. If this address conflicts with another slave on board customer could use this field to override the address

bitfields.name: ISP_USB_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined GPIO for USB VBUS detect function during ISP mode

values.name: USB0_VBUS
values.description: Customer defined GPIO for USB0_VBUS detect

values.name: USB1_VBUS
values.description: Customer defined GPIO for USB1_VBUS detect

values.name: VDD_USB
values.description: Use VDD_USB for VBUS presence. On board regulator should generate VDD_USB voltage using 5V input fo VBUS pin on connector

bitfields.name: ISP_CAN_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined CAN ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined SPI ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_I2C_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined I2C ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_UART_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined UART ISP pins

bitfields.name: SPIDEN

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Flash Mass Erase Command Enable

bitfields.name: UUID_CHECK
bitfields.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: Debug certificate can be used with all devices

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Debug certificate per device with matching UUID is needed

bitfields.name: Inverse_value
bitfields.description: Inverse Value

registers.name: CC_SOCU_DFLT
registers.description: Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Debug Filter

bitfields.name: NIDEN
bitfields.description: Non Secure non-invasive debug Fixed state

bitfields.name: DBGEN
bitfields.description: Non Secure debug Fixed state

bitfields.name: SPNIDEN
bitfields.description: Secure non-invasive debug Fixed state

bitfields.name: SPIDEN
bitfields.description: Secure invasive debug Fixed state

bitfields.name: ISP_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: ISP command Fixed state

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Set FA mode command Fixed state

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Mass erase flash command fixed state

bitfields.name: Inverse_value
bitfields.description: Inverse Value

registers.name: VENDOR_USAGE
registers.description: Vendor Usage

bitfields.name: VENDOR_USAGE
bitfields.description: Vendor Usage [31:16]. Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area (CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU)

registers.name: Reserved 0x0004C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: SECURE_BOOT_CFG
registers.description: Secure Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: Secure boot enforcement. This field defines the minimum image verification procedure (CRC32, CMAC, ECDSA sign). The Image type field in header indicates the type of verification data (checksum or signature) included in it. Note: Plain < CRC32 < CMAC < ECDSA

values.name: CRC32_IMAGES
values.description: Only CRC32 or signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed

values.name: SIGNED_IMAGES
values.description: Only Signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed

values.name: ECDSA_SIGNED
values.description: Only ECDSA signed images are allowed

bitfields.name: LP_SEC_BOOT
bitfields.description: Secure boot option for low-power wake from power-down and deep-powerdown. For CFPA/CMPA do CRC check always

values.name: CHECK_CRC32
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & CRC32 check of active image

values.name: CHECK_JUMP
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & jump to vector address specified in CFPA

values.name: CMAC_CHECK
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & CMAC check of active image

bitfields.name: ENF_CNSA
bitfields.description: Enforce CNSA suite approved algorithms for secure boot, secure update and debug authentication. Note, CMAC image authentication is only allowed in 2b'00 setting

values.name: LIMITED_0B01
values.description: 384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used

values.name: LIMITED_0B10
values.description: 384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used

values.name: LIMITED_0B11
values.description: 384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used

bitfields.name: ENF_TZM_PRESET
bitfields.description: Enforce TrustZone-M mode

values.name: ENFORCE_0B01
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest

values.name: ENFORCE_0B10
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest

values.name: ENFORCE_0B11
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest

bitfields.name: ITRC_ZEROIZE
bitfields.description: RAM zeroize on ITRC event. Zeroize long-term storage RAM (RAMA) on subsequent boot when Intrusion and Tamper control signals an intrusion event (ITRC_OUT3). Note, when ITRC is re-configured in application then ITRC_OUT4 (CHIP_RESET) should be triggered with at least same events as ITRC_OUT3 (RAM_ZEROIZE)

values.name: PKC_RAM_ON_ITRC
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC RAM on ITRC event only

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ON_ITRC
values.description: Zeroize PKC & RAMA on ITRC event only

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ALL_RESET
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC & RAMA on all reset boot

bitfields.name: ACTIVE_IMG_PROT
bitfields.description: Protection of active image. This field defines protection of flash area occupied by the active image. Only applicable to internal flash

values.name: FLASH_ACL_PROTECTION
values.description: Protection is defined using the CFPA FLASH_ACL settings

values.name: WITH_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC2 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

values.name: NO_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area without sticky lock. GLBAC4 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

values.name: XOM_PROTECTION
values.description: XOM protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC6 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

bitfields.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for SHA2 block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: FIPS_AES_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for AES block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: FIPS_ECDSA_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for ECDSA block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: FIPS_DRBG_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for DRBG block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: FIPS_CMAC_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for CMAC block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: FIPS_KDF_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for KDF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: FIPS_PUF_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for PUF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

bitfields.name: SKIP_DICE
bitfields.description: Skip DICE computation

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bitfields.description: Include NXP area (IFR1) containing specific part configuration data defined during chip manufacturing process in DICE computation

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_CUST_CFG
bitfields.description: Include data from CMPA page (512 bytes) in DICE computation

bitfields.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 0. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 1. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 2. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 3. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX0
bitfields.description: Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 0 settings. Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN field

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX1
bitfields.description: Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 1 settings. Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN field

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX2
bitfields.description: Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 2 settings. Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN field

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX3
bitfields.description: Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 3 settings. Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN field

registers.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
registers.description: Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image (sectors .Recovery image is programmed in BANK1_IFR0. But if the image size is more than 32KB, this field can be used to indicate sectors to include in recovery image.ROM will configure flash protection setting for these sectors the same as BANK1_IFR0 before exiting to user code. The protection settings are managed through CMPA.OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT. The lower 8 sectors are excluded from this mask to avoid conflicts with dual image boot feature.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_0
registers.description: Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins high after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0
registers.description: Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins low. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_1 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_1 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: CMPA_CRC32
registers.description: CRC32 of CMPA page data from offset . ROM updates this field along with CMPA_CMAC. ROM uses this field based on CMPA.LP_SEC_BOOT field option.

registers.name: CMPA_CMAC0
registers.description: CMAC[31:0] of CMPA page data from offset . ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

registers.name: CMPA_CMAC1
registers.description: CMAC[31:0] of CMPA page data from offset . ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

registers.description: CMAC[31:0] of CMPA page data from offset . ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.
